p: Chiliadenus glutinosus is a species of the Asteraceae family, distributed throughout the eastern half of the Iberian Peninsula ( Figure 1) and used popularly for various therapeutic purposes. Its presence is confirmed in 34 of the 50 provinces, and 14 of the 17 regions (Autonomous Communities), that make up the national territory, and medicinal uses of the species have been reported in at least 20 provinces [ 7, 17].
